alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Volusia and Seminole, northeast Orange and northern Brevard Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Flagler Beach to 6 miles west of Port Orange to near Chuluota. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Titusville, Ormond Beach and New Smyrna Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
